concept-wr.title: Firewall Options
concept-wr.shortdesc: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade incorporates a firewall for the OAM network. During initial configuration, you can specify an additional file in order to augment or override the default rules.

conbody.p: For more information about specifying a firewall rules file during controller configuration, see .

The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade firewall uses the Netfilter framework to implement a firewall on the OAM network. If the system is configured to support an optional firewall rules file, you can introduce custom rules by adding entries in this file.
Two input chains are supported for custom rules: INPUT-custom-pre, for rules to be processed before the default rules, and INPUT-custom-post, for rules to be processed after the default rules.
A minimal set of rules is always applied before any custom rules, as follows:

li.p: Service manager (SM) traffic is always accepted.

conbody.p: For the default rules used by HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade, see . For more about custom rules, see .
You can validate the file using the following command:$ iptables-restore --noflush --test < filenamewhere filename is the path and name of the file.

note.p: Validation is recommended before you run the configuration controller script. If the file is invalid, you must correct any errors and then start the script again from the beginning.
